page.title: 07FLEETWOOD MARITIME MUSEUM
page.content: As Fleetwood has existed only since 1836, the made-real dream of Sir Peter Hesketh Fleetwood, it has had a local history Museum since the town's free library opened in 1887. Three years ago the Lancashire Museum Service extended it to provide a permanent Lancashire sea fisheries exhibition. This is open from Easter to October, 6 days a week from 2p.m.to 5p.m. plus 10.30a.m. to 12.30 on Fridays; 25p for adults and 10p for children. On the ground floor is a free local history section showing Fleetwood as it was:Fire Brigade, Lifeboats, buses, trains and trawlers. The Maritime Museum in the basement has model boats, a Wheelhouse, an Otter Board, nets used for shrimping and displays of types of fish caught in the area. Most children love the Wheel House and thoroughly enjoy visits to the Museum.
